com.thoughtworks.robot.direcctions
Class Direction

java.lang.Object
  com.thoughtworks.robot.direcctions.Direction
Direct Known Subclasses:
EastDirection, NorthDirection, SouthDirection, WestDirection
public abstract class Direction
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a base class for all Direction classes. Each direction is treated as separate class and this class provides basic skeleton for new Direction classes. Each Direction should have a code and order. A code is nothing but a simple String value which represents a direction and order is a numeric value which represents cyclic place/order of particular direction.

Example: Let's say we have 4 directions (EAST, WEST, NORTH and SOUTH) and if we arrange them in cyclic order they will be arranged as EAST->NORTH->WEST->SOUTH->EAST. We can not sort them by name (direction code) that's we need an integer order value to put a particular direction at right place in cyclic order. In future, let's say we want to add new direction (between NOTH and EAST as NORTHEAST) so, we'll assign an integer value/order to NORTHEAST so that it lies between NORTH and EAST's order value.

Author:
sshinde

updateCoordinates

public abstract void updateCoordinates(Robot robot)
Method which will be implemented by all direction classes extended from this class. The implementation should update X,Y or Z coordinate values based on the directional movement of Robot

Parameters:
robot - A robot instance who's coordinates needs to be updated.
See Also:
EastDirection, WestDirection, NorthDirection, SouthDirection

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
Overridden method which compares two Direction(S) and returns true/false. Two directions are treated as same when they have same Direction.directionCode and Direction.order. If you there is need, users can override this method again based on need.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
object - another Direction object.
Returns:
boolean true/false
